title: Pulses dropped, $500bn purchase clause revised: What’s new in updated India-US trade deal factsheet
content: The US has revised its factsheet on the trade deal with India, notably removing any mention of pulses from the list of agricultural exports. Additionally, the language regarding India's commitment to purchasing American goods has shifted from a firm commitment to an intention to buy, impacting the description of proposed procurements.

title: Exclusive: Mumbai Indians say no to RCB playing IPL matches at DY Patil Stadium
content: Mumbai Indians have denied Royal Challengers Bengaluru permission to use DY Patil Stadium for IPL 2026, citing catchment area restrictions that require an NOC from MI. With Navi Mumbai ruled out, RCB are exploring Raipur and Indore while KSCA continues to push for a return to Chinnaswamy.

title: K-pop, cartoons and online games: Ghaziabad sisters spent 20 hours a day on phone
content: Police investigating the alleged suicides of three sisters in Ghaziabad recovered data from a sold mobile phone, revealing extensive daily use for Korean content, cartoons, and gaming. The recovered material aligns with details mentioned in their suicide note, prompting authorities to seek a ban on specific games.

title: Sam Altman's advice to employees and investors: Here's what he said
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman reports renewed momentum, with ChatGPT exceeding 10% monthly growth and over 800 million weekly users. The company is also launching an updated chat model and sees "insane" 50% weekly growth in its Codex coding product.

title: T20 World Cup: Abhishek Sharma hospitalised ahead of clash vs Namibia
content: Abhishek Sharma has been hospitalised with an infection, casting doubt on his availability for India's next T20 World Cup match. He was unwell before the previous game, with his condition worsening after playing. The left-hander didn't train with the team at the Arun Jaitley Stadium on Tuesday. India will take on Namibia on Thursday.

title: Tendulkar invites PM Modi, Rahul Gandhi for Arjun-Saaniya wedding ceremony
content: Sachin Tendulkar met Rahul Gandhi and invited him, along with President Droupadi Murmu, PM Narendra Modi and Amit Shah, to Arjun Tendulkar and Saaniya Chandok’s wedding. Arjun, now with Lucknow Super Giants, has had a mixed IPL career and represents Goa domestically. Saaniya is from the Graviss Group family and a longtime friend of the Tendulkars.

title: Microsoft appoints its first 'Engineering Quality Head,' and here's why that matters
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella appointed Charlie Bell as the new head of engineering quality, a move occurring as AI-generated code increases alongside reported bugs. This comes amid challenges with Windows 11 reliability and underwhelming Copilot adoption, raising questions about the company's AI strategy and product quality.

title: TS TET result declared at tgtet.aptonline.in: Direct link to download scorecards here
content: The Department of School Education, Telangana, has declared the TS TET Results 2026 on February 10. Candidates who appeared for the January examination can now access their scorecards online and check qualifying status. Conducted for teaching eligibility in Classes 1 to 8, the results and final answer key mark a key step toward future recruitment processes.

title: Rajpal Yadav's net worth: From movie fees to brand endorsement income, all you need to know
content: In a shocking turn of events, Bollywood actor Rajpal Yadav finds himself behind bars at Tihar jail due to a bounced check linked to a contentious film investment. His financial situation shows a net worth ranging from Rs 50-85 crore, bolstered by his roles in movies like 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Chandu Champion'. Read on to know more.

title: SpaceX delays Mars mission, Musk says: ‘It is only possible to travel to Mars when …’
content: SpaceX is shifting its near-term focus from Mars to establishing a self-sustaining city on the Moon, citing faster timelines and more frequent launch opportunities. Elon Musk stated a Moon city could be achieved in under 10 years, while Mars would take over two decades.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: IFCI, Swiggy, and Fortis are the top stocks to buy today (February 11, 2026), according toMehul Kothari, DVP - Technical Research, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers. Here’s a detailed outlook:

title: After 'India players have superior bats' remark, Rajapaksa makes new post
content: Sri Lanka’s Bhanuka Rajapaksa clarified his controversial comments on Indian bats, saying his words were misunderstood and meant as praise, not an accusation of bat-tampering. He lauded India’s advanced cricket system and top bat manufacturers, admitting he should have given clearer context. His earlier remarks triggered online debate, but no ICC complaint was filed.

title: Oscars 2026 luncheon highlights: Ema Stone, Kate Hudson, Michael B Jordan, and others arrive in style
content: The 2026 Oscars nominees luncheon at the Beverly Hilton fostered genuine camaraderie among contenders like Emma Stone and Teyana Taylor. Nominees shared hugs and laughter, celebrating their shared journey and the rare opportunity to connect before the awards ceremony. This event highlighted the personal connections forged amidst fierce competition.

title: Warriors trade rumors: Grizzlies guard could boost 2026 playoff push
content: Golden State Warriors are eyeing veteran guard Eric Gordon from the buyout market to bolster their bench for the playoffs. Gordon, recently waived by Memphis, offers proven perimeter shooting and playoff experience. His potential low-cost signing could provide crucial spacing and veteran presence alongside Stephen Curry, enhancing the team's offensive depth without disrupting the core rotation.

title: Spurs vs Lakers injury report: Who’s playing, out and questionable
content: The San Antonio Spurs, riding a four-game winning streak and holding a strong position in the Western Conference, visit the Los Angeles Lakers. The Lakers are significantly hampered by multiple key player injuries, including LeBron James and Luka Dončić, impacting their depth and offensive capabilities. San Antonio, with a healthier roster, is favored to win.

title: Ayesha Curry steals spotlight with Stephen Curry at movie premiere
content: NBA star Stephen Curry and his wife Ayesha Curry recently graced the premiere of the animated film 'GOAT' in Los Angeles. Ayesha, who voices a character named Carol, shared photos with Stephen, who lends his voice to Lenny Williamson. The power couple's appearance at the star-studded event generated significant fan excitement and well wishes for their Hollywood venture.

title: Delhi tragedy: Drunk labourer dies after falling into open sewer manhole in Rohini
content: A 30-year-old labourer tragically died after falling into an open sewer manhole in Delhi's Rohini area. The man, identified as Birju Kumar, was reportedly in an inebriated state when he lost his balance and fell into the approximately 14-foot-deep pit on Monday evening. Despite a rescue operation, he was recovered unconscious and later declared dead at a hospital.

title: ICC T20 World Cup 2026: Full Match Schedule For February 11
content: February 11 brings three key T20 World Cup 2026 matches: Afghanistan vs South Africa, Australia vs Ireland, and England vs West Indies. Afghanistan aim to bounce back against a strong Proteas side, while Australia begin their campaign against upset-prone Ireland. England and West Indies, both two-time champions, clash in a high-profile encounter, with both teams in good recent form.

title: Government confident it did better in battle of wits with opposition
content: Opposition's bid to remove the Speaker failed, exposing internal rifts as pragmatic voices pushed for legislative business. The government emerged stronger, refusing Congress's demands, while regional parties' desire for discussions on their concerns helped end the impasse. The Speaker stepped aside until the notice is addressed.

title: Happy promise day: Top 70+ wishes, messages, greetings and quotes
content: Promise Day arrives on February 11, encouraging genuine communication and effort in relationships. It offers a pause for honesty and reassurance, emphasizing presence and consistency over grand gestures. This day serves as a simple reminder to nurture connections amidst busy lives. It highlights that small, achievable promises build real trust and strengthen bonds.

title: 'Border 2' box office collection: Sunny Deol film surpasses Rs 426 crore globally
content: 'Border 2' is still captivating audiences on the big screen, celebrating 19 days of box office success with a current collection of Rs 2.84 crore. This gripping war drama, which leverages the excitement of the Republic Day holiday for a stellar debut, has already amassed an impressive Rs 314.59 crore in domestic earnings.

title: UK: Teen arrested for stabbing two boys at London school
content: A 13-year-old suspect was arrested by UK police following a stabbing incident at Kingsbury High School in northwest London. Two boys, aged 12 and 13, were seriously injured and hospitalized. Counter-terrorism officers are leading the investigation into the attack, with the motive still under review.

title: UK-India FTA gets compared to ‘bag of soggy poppadums’ in House of Commons debate
content: UK MPs across parties criticized the UK-India FTA in the House of Commons, citing concerns over services, National Insurance evasion, delayed tariff reductions for British goods, and a lack of enforceable human rights clauses. Critics warned of cheap imports and the potential impact on British workers, particularly concerning the double contributions convention.

title: No bunkers built in border areas even 10 months after Op Sindoor
content: Bunker construction in Jammu and Kashmir border areas remains stalled nearly 10 months after heavy Pakistani shelling. Local MLAs highlight the urgent need for individual bunkers due to the scattered population. While over 500 bunkers are sanctioned for Uri, work is expected in April 2026. A proposal for 5,693 bunkers in Poonch is awaiting approval.

title: SC's gender handbook is too 'Harvard-oriented': CJI
content: Chief Justice Surya Kant criticized the Supreme Court's gender stereotype handbook as overly technical and inaccessible to common people and rape survivors. He emphasized the need for practical training for High Court judges on handling sexual assault cases. The bench set aside an insensitive Allahabad High Court ruling on an attempted rape case.

title: Love, but no passage: What a killing changed for Meitei-Kuki couples
content: A brutal killing of a Meitei man visiting his Kuki fiancée in Churachandpur has shattered the fragile peace for inter-ethnic couples in Manipur.  The incident, captured on video, has reignited fear and deepened the divide, forcing many couples into renewed separation and uncertainty. Hopes for reconciliation are now stalled.

title: Days ahead of elections, another Hindu man is killed in Bangladesh
content: A 62-year-old rice trader, Susen Chandra Sarkar, was brutally murdered in his shop in Mymensingh, Bangladesh, just days before the February 12 elections. Unidentified assailants hacked him to death and looted cash. This incident fuels fears among minority communities, with international groups warning of potential attacks.

title: 3-hr takedown, AI labels: Govt cracks down on deepfakes
content: India has significantly tightened digital rules to combat deepfakes, mandating clear labelling and traceability for AI-generated content. Social media platforms now face stricter compliance, with reduced timelines for takedown of unlawful material and direct responsibility placed on senior officers. These new regulations aim to enhance user safety and accountability in the digital space.

title: Any copies in circulation amount to copyright infringement, says Penguin
content: Rahul Gandhi continues to cite Gen M M Naravane's memoir, 'Four Stars of Destiny', despite publisher Penguin India stating it remains unpublished. Gandhi insists Naravane's own social media post confirms its availability, challenging Penguin's claim and suggesting a contradiction. The publisher maintains pre-orders do not constitute publication and warns of legal action against unauthorized circulation.

title: Niti Aayog seeks diesel vehicle phase-out, focus on cleaner tech
content: Niti Aayog has proposed a roadmap for India's transport sector to achieve net zero emissions by 2070. The strategy involves phasing out diesel vehicles and promoting cleaner technologies like CNG, hybrids, and electric vehicles. Stricter Corporate Average Fuel Efficiency (CAFE) norms will also be implemented to support this transition.

title: ‘Washing dirty linen in court’: HC tells kin of late industrialist Sunjay Kapur to go for mediation
content: The Delhi High Court urged the family of late industrialist Sunjay Kapur to pursue mediation to resolve their disputes, advising them not to let wealth become a curse. The court emphasized peaceful resolution and equitable sharing of assets, highlighting the founder's legacy. This comes amidst lawsuits concerning a family trust and a will.

title: ED summons Anil, Tina in Rs 40,000cr bank fraud case
content: The ED has issued fresh summonses to Anil Ambani and his wife Tina for questioning next week in connection with an alleged Rs 40,000 crore money laundering probe. The agency has already attached Rs 12,000 crore worth of assets. Tina Ambani's questioning is related to the purchase of a Manhattan apartment using alleged proceeds of crime.

title: TaMo, long-time partner Stellantis ink fresh MoU
content: Tata Motors and Stellantis are exploring new manufacturing, engineering, and supply chain collaborations, building on their existing two-decade joint venture. This partnership aims to leverage synergies and navigate evolving automotive megatrends like powertrain shifts and software-defined vehicles. The move signifies a strategic step for both global players in India's growing mobility sector.

title: Joblessness among those aged 15 and above falls in rural, urban areas in Oct-Dec: PLFS
content: India's unemployment rate for those 15 and above in rural areas dropped to 4% in Oct-Dec 2025, down from 4.4% in the previous quarter. The overall Labour Force Participation Rate also saw a marginal increase to 55.8%, with female participation rising to 34.9%.

title: Centre proposes spl NIA courts in 17 states, SC seeks their reply
content: Responding to Supreme Court's push, the Centre will establish at least one special court in 17 states for NIA terror cases. Each state will receive ₹1 crore for costs, with existing courts to be designated for these trials. This move aims to expedite justice for serious crimes, preventing prolonged detentions due to overloaded dockets.

title: CPI, CPM move SC for FIR against Himanta over 'target-shooting' video
content: CPM and CPI have filed petitions in the Supreme Court seeking FIRs and an SIT probe against Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. The petitions cite alleged hate speeches and a recent video showing Sarma firing at an image of Muslim men, with accompanying phrases like 'no mercy'.

title: No-confidence motion: Speaker Om Birla not to preside till decision on oppn's notice
content: The Congress on Tuesday moved a no-confidence notice against Birla, accusing him of repeated partisan conduct during the ongoing Budget session. The party alleged that he denied leader of the opposition Rahul Gandhi the opportunity to speak and ordered the suspension of opposition MPs. Sources told news agency ANI that opposition MPs alleged "blatantly partisan" conduct and that leaders of Opposition parties were not allowed to speak.

title: Trade concerns, LAC stability top focus in India-China Strategic Dialogue
content: In their talks, Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and his Chinese counterpart Ma Zhaoxu primarily focussed on steps taken by the two sides to stabilise and rebuild bilateral ties that had come under severe strain

title: Telangana Municipal Polls 2026 LIVE updates: Voting under way for 116 Municipalities, seven Municipal Corporations
content: The polls are being conducted in 2,569 Wards in 116 Municipalities and 412 Wards in seven Municipal Corporations across the State

title: A wildlife association that helped conserve the Nilgiris’ biodiversity
content: The NWEA came into existence in colonial India, when British colonists discovered a “hunters’ paradise” in the Nilgiris

title: Actor Ranveer Singh receives threat
content: Security around his residence was increased after Singh received a threat through a voice note and approached police, an official said

title: A poem on St. Thomas Mount
content: The poem, titled ‘St. Thomas’s Mount’, was written around 1769 or thereabouts for it mentions the attacks on the place by Hyder Ali in 1767 and the cyclone of 1768

title: Why India needs political change to retain women in STEM
content: Gender diversity widens the range of questions that the scientific enterprise treats as legitimate and the social problems it deems worth solving

title: Draft DAP aims to align defence acquisition with rapidly evolving geo-strategic landscape: Government
content: The draft DAP-2026 document has been uploaded on the website of the Defence Ministry, and it seeks comments or suggestions on it from various stakeholders

title: M.G. Ramachandran’s hospitalisation in the U.S. and homecoming after treatment
content: MGR was flown to America on November 6, 1984, on a chartered Air India flight and was admitted to the Downstate Medical Centre in Brooklyn, New York. At the time of admission, he was not fully conscious after suffering a stroke. Later, he underwent a kidney transplant surgery at the hospital.

title: Residents object to relaying of OMR without cold-milling
content: A resident of Perungudi says that in many places the slope was too steep and vehicles find it difficult to climb up the road from the service lane

title: Chambal aqueduct set to facilitate water supply from river link project in Rajasthan
content: A new Chambal aqueduct in Rajasthan will enhance water supply for drinking and irrigation across 17 districts

title: CM Naidu seeks Central support for irrigation and infrastructure projects in A.P.
content: He expresses concern over Karnataka’s move to increase height of Almatti dam and seeks ₹32,000 crore for Polavaram Phase-II and Makhana Development Board in Kolleru region

title: Elderly woman dies, seven injured at temple procession in M.P.’s Gwalior
content: Deputy Inspector General of Police, Gwalior Range, said that of the seven injured, six are out of danger, while a woman who received serious injuries is currently under observation in Gwalior

title: Only achievable special status for J&K is Statehood: Congress leader Karra
content: It’s the first time since the reading down of Article 370 that the Congress has openly decided to shun any demand of special status for J&K like the ruling National Conference and Peoples Democratic Party

title: Three women killed by tusker in Odisha
content: The incident happened in Lochapalli village under Dhenkanal Sadar police limits, where several women had gone to Patpuri Reserve Forest to collect firewood

title: Villagers in Odisha boycott anganwadi over appointment of Dalit employee
content: We are making efforts to ensure that the children return so that their pre-school education is not affected, says Child Development Project Officer Deepali Mishra

title: BJP pips Congress to mayor’s post in Chandrapur with Sena (UBT) help
content: Chandrapur is one of the few municipal corporations in Mahrashtra where the Congress had emerged as the largest party. It won 27 seats, becoming the largest party in the 66-member civic body

title: Trade deal will hit J&K’s horticulture sector the most: CM Omar Abdullah
content: The Chief Minister also defended the welfare measures introduced in the J&K budget and accused Opposition parties of criticising it “for the heck of it”

title: Sambhal violence case: HC stays order to register FIR against police personnel
content: The High Court ordered registration of an FIR, stating that the truth could only be unearthed through a proper investigation

title: French President Macron to visit India next week
content: He will attend the AI Impact Summit and hold talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi to boost ties in key sectors such as trade and defence

title: Kochi Corporation looking for new agency to hand over operation of ro-ro services
content: Ro-ro services are a drain on Corporation resources as they have been reporting huge losses, and the civic body is exploring the possibility of roping in KMRL to manage their operations, says Mayor

title: Lokesh lauds teacher’s efforts to make teaching a joyful experience
content: Tejasri teaches children moral values, cleanliness, and healthy habits through games and songs, says the HRD Minister

title: Court summons complainant in jewellery theft case related to Sivaganga custodial death
content: So far, 10 police personnel have been named as accused in the custodial death case. The CBI has filed a charge sheet and a supplementary charge sheet

title: DMK should win seats only in single digit in T.N. Assembly poll, says Anbumani
content: He alleges that across the State, people from all sections are extremely angry with the DMK government

title: T.N. likely to become $150 billion electronics hub by 2030, says State Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa
content: He points out that the State’s share in India’s total electronics exports during FY2025 was around 41% at $15 billion, and this is likely to have increased to 45% in FY2026. He also expresses concern that the Centre has not yet released State-wise data on electronics exports for the current financial year

title: 'This is the status of the book': Ex-army chief MM Naravane reacts to row over memoir
content: Former Army chief Manoj Mukund Naravane has backed his publisher, Penguin, regarding his unpublished memoir, "Four Stars of Destiny." The book's circulation has sparked a political storm, leading to an FIR and Lok Sabha disruptions after an excerpt was attempted to be quoted by Rahul Gandhi. Penguin stated that any circulating copies are unauthorized and infringe copyright.

title: Devadasi survey: 6,222 fresh applications still pending before taluk/district panels in Karnataka
content: Amid questions over the nearly 50% decline in the number of former Devadasis across 15 districts in Karnataka in the latest survey report, 6,222 fresh applications to be included in the list of former devadasis are pending before taluk/district-level committees

title: APSCHE marks quantum milestone with large-scale training initiative
content: Chairman Madhu Murthy says over 1,000 faculty members and 1,00,000 students were trained, with ₹8 lakh awarded to students during AQVH 2025

title: Trade deal with U.S. ‘best possible’ amid shifting global order, Foreign Secretary tells House panel
content: Vikram Misri assured the Parliamentary Standing Committee on External Affairs that farmers’ interests would be protected and would not be compromised under the deal

title: Amit Shah calls for urgent action to stem the rot of cyberfraud
content: Cybersecurity is no longer limited to economic security, but is now an integral part of national security, said Mr. Shah

title: Chikkamagaluru farmer cuts sandalwood branches near Vidhana Soudha to protest NHAI action on his farm
content: NHAI has taken over four acres of land at Haliyur for the NH-206 work. Vishu Kumar, a sandalwood grower, alleged that he has been denied a fair compensation

title: Family forced to carry body of relative home on two-wheeler in Andhra Pradesh as government hospital has no ambulance
content: When the impoverished family approached private auto drivers, they demanded up to ₹2,000 to transport the body. Collector says Bapatla Area Hospital did not have a hearse van as it did not qualify to have one based on mortality figures.

title: Supreme Court asks Election Commission to consider writ petitioner’s suggestions against excessive poll expenditure
content: Citing a report on poll spending, the petitioner asks for rethink on expenses cap, plan of action against erring candidates; ECI defends its oversight mechanism, questions the report’s authenticity

title: Stale food seized during raids in Guntur
content: Food Safety and Legal Metrology officials inspect 16 food units across the city, seize cooked food and sweets, and issue notices for hygiene lapses and licence violations

title: VMC council approves revised expenditure budget of ₹1.64 lakh crore for 2026-27
content: Budget estimates, both capital income and expenditure, revised after YSRCP corporators raise objections to allocation of ₹450 crore for stormwater drain project

title: Mohammed Deepak gets wave of support across India after news of his gym membership decline goes viral
content: Mr. Deepak came into the national spotlight after he confronted a mob of right-wing members accused of harassing a 71-year-old Muslim garment seller and pressuring him to change the name of his shop

title: We suspect that Ajit Pawar’s death was sabotage, not an accident, says family
content: During his one-and-a-half hour press conference, Mr. Rohit Pawar claimed that there were contradictions about the timing of the crash in the ATC transcript and in the report given by the Union Aviation Ministry

title: Congress likely to focus on trade deal as Budget discussion gets underway in Lok Sabha
content: Rahul Gandhi to speak in the House; Opposition agrees to allow normal functioning to raise crucial issues, including the trade deal, during the Budget discussion

title: Retired IB officer to lead peace talks with Naga, Kuki-Zo groups as MHA’s Northeast Adviser
content: Ajit Lal is a retired IPS officer, former JIC chief, and former IB special director; though the newly-elected BJP recommended him as interlocutor for the Naga peace talks in 2014, he was passed over for R.N. Ravi, now T.N. Governor

title: Election Commission extends deadline for Bengal SIR hearings to February 14
content: Extension follows a Supreme Court order and a request from the Chief Electoral Officer of West Bengal which cited pending hearings, scrutiny, and digitisation work; final rolls to be published on February 28

title: Career progression of Agniveers: Home Ministry sidesteps Rahul Gandhi’s query
content: Home Ministry cites Allocation of Business rules to justify coordinating post-service transition of ex-Agniveers, without addressing concerns over overlap with Defence Ministry.

title: Former Army General Naravane confirms Penguin’s claim that memoir is as yet unpublished as Delhi Police file FIR
content: “No copies of the book, either in print or digital form, have been published, distributed, sold, or otherwise made available to the public by Penguin Random House India,” the publishing house said; Gen. Naravane’s clarification follows remarks by Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who cited a December 2023 social media post by the former Army Chief to counter the publisher’s claim

title: Watch: Rohit Pawar questions Ajit Pawar aircraft crash, seeks international probe
content: NCP (SP) leader Rohit Pawar has raised serious questions over whether the aircraft crash involving Ajit Pawar was an accident or a planned conspiracy. He flagged missing technical data, alleged safety lapses and last-minute crew changes, while demanding clarity on fuel practices and flight decisions. Pawar has now called for an independent international investigation alongside the government probe.

title: Why can’t Human Rights Commission become ‘ad hoc’ Information Commission in States with few RTI appeals, asks Supreme Court
content: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant, heading a three-judge Bench, says the ‘ad-hoc mechanism’ could continue till the number of RTI appeals increases in ‘due course of time’ and ‘justifies the creation of an independent Information Commission’

title: Opposition questions Centre on price rise, growing inequality in Rajya Sabha
content: Pointing at various reports on widening inequality in the country, Trinamool Congress MP Sukhendu Sekhar Roy warns of social upheaval if the government does not address it

title: ED steps into Tirumala laddu ghee adulteration case
content: Agency registers case and initiates probe amid indications of hawala transactions linked to ghee procurement approvals

title: VACB opens preliminary inquiry into installation of new flag mast at the Sabarimala Ayyappa temple in 2017
content: The UDF-appointed TDB had ordered the installation under the questionable premise that termites had infested the concrete pillar, which was covered with gold-plated copper cladding, rendering it unstable. Former TDB member and Congress leader Ajay Tharayil denies any wrongdoing and says the decision had the sanction of the High Court-appointed Amicus Curiae

title: Key chord line to ease Secunderabad congestion nears completion
content: Signalling interlocking works are currently underway, after which the section will be opened for traffic; officials estimate that the new route will save up to 30 minutes of travel time, as trains will no longer need to take a 15‑km detour via Malkajgiri and Lallaguda Gate stations

title: ‘One-sided’ deal will flood Indian markets with U.S. products, say MPs
content: It will adversely affect farmers as well as industry, and dent the Make-in-India initiative, says Opposition in Lok Sabha

title: Bharatiya Kisan Union opposes deal with U.S., to burn effigies of Modi, Trump
content: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait says Centre had lost the trust of farmers and the trade agreements with U.S. and European Union will have far-reaching adverse impacts on farmers

title: Watch: Congress-led Opposition moves no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker
content: Opposition parties led by the Congress on February 10 moved a no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, accusing him of partisan conduct amid repeated disruptions in the House.

title: BRS accuses State government of allowing A.P. draw excess Krishna water
content: BRS leader and former minister Harish Rao says A.P. has availed 80% water already against its ad hoc entitlement of 66%

title: Speaker to stay away from Lok Sabha proceedings till Opposition’s petition against him is disposed of
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju posts February 4 Lok Sabha footage, showing women Congress MPs near PM’s seat; says “very ugly scenes” were prevented by restraining BJP members

title: Students from Karnataka can practice as nurses in Kerala, says HC
content: Several BSc Nursing students from nursing colleges in Karnataka were being denied registration in Kerala

title: Soldier due for disability pension, if chronic disability was due to military service: Kerala HC
content: Court directs payment of disability pension arrears to B. Manikuttan, a native of Mavelikara who served as a Havildar in the Army

title: Naidu presses Centre for statutory backing to Amaravati, financial support
content: Chief Minister discusses Amaravati capital Bill, State finances and key issues with Union Home and Finance Ministers in New Delhi

title: Watch: India–U.S. trade deal a surrender of reciprocity, says Tharoor
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor criticised the India–U.S. interim trade agreement during the Lok Sabha Budget debate, calling it a pre-committed purchase pact rather than a fair trade deal.

title: Scientists showcase advances in health care, genetics and knowledge systems at research conference
content: A major highlight of the day at the National Research Conference being held in Thiruvananthapuram was a breakthrough in Alzheimer’s research that could transform early diagnosis for Kerala’s ageing population

title: T.N. officials prepare for upcoming Census 2027 activities
content: During the session, the critical nature of the exercise was emphasised upon and a roadmap of the essential action points to be prioritized by was provided

title: SB LX, halftime show fall shy of ratings records
content: Seattle's 29-13 victory over New England in Super Bowl LX averaged 124.9 million viewers, while Bad Bunny's halftime show averaged 128.2 million, both falling short of setting records for most-watched U.S. broadcast and halftime show.

title: Lakers rule out LeBron, ending All-NBA run at 21
content: The Lakers will be without LeBron James (foot), Luka Doncic (hamstring) and Austin Reaves (calf) for Tuesday's game against the Spurs. The missed game rules James out for postseason awards, ending his 21-season, All-NBA streak.

title: Kubiak, Davis want Crosby to remain a Raider
content: New Raiders coach Klint Kubiak and team owner Mark Davis made it clear Tuesday that they want Maxx Crosby to remain with the Raiders.

title: Tiger's son commits to play golf for FSU in 2027
content: Charlie Woods, the son of Tiger Woods, has verbally committed to play golf at Florida State and will be a member of the 2027 recruiting class.

title: U.S. hockey posts biggest Olympic win vs. Canada
content: Hannah Bilka scored twice to lead the United States women's hockey team to a dominating 5-0 victory over Canada on Tuesday at the Milan Cortina Olympics.

title: Quinn: QB Daniels could play more under center
content: Commanders coach Dan Quinn said the ability to unlock more from quarterback Jayden Daniels factored into the decision to change offensive coordinators after the season.

title: Montana LB Tuliaupupu granted 9th year by NCAA
content: Montana linebacker Solomon Tuliaupupu will return for the 2026 season after being granted a ninth year of eligibility by the NCAA.

title: Rory: Players 'amazing' but four majors is enough
content: Rory McIlroy believes the Players Championship is one of the best tournaments in the world but pushed back on the narrative that it should be men's golf's fifth major.

title: 👀 The truth behind Super Bowl consolation prize
content: Some conference championship rings fetch big bucks. Others wind up collecting dust on a closet shelf. Players share mixed opinions on the NFL's sparkly consolation prize.

title: 10 teams, 12 quarterbacks, no great options: Sorting the lackluster NFL quarterback market
content: There are no surefire free agent QBs available this March, and the draft class has only one first-round lock. So what now for teams that might need a quarterback?

title: What we know about Luka's Lakers fit, 365 days after his debut: Big decisions loom
content: Let's revisit the first 365 days of the Luka Doncic era in Los Angeles and examine how the Lakers can return to championship contention.

title: What this NBA trade deadline revealed: Teams are finding new ways to tank
content: Much to the irritation of some league insiders, the trade deadline was more than just a flurry of moves.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: USA women's hockey downs Canada 5-0, Ilia Malinin takes lead in Milan
content: On Tuesday at the Winter Olympics, the U.S. women's hockey team faced rival Canada while Ilia Malinin took the ice, among other notable events.

title: Naumov dedicates Olympic debut to late parents
content: U.S. figure skater Maxim Naumov carried the memory of his late parents with him to the Olympics on Tuesday night, delivering an emotional, heartfelt short program at the Milan Cortina Games that fulfilled a dream they had long shared together.

title: What the Charles Bediako ruling means for Alabama and future NCAA eligibility cases
content: The former two-way NBA player's request to keep playing for his old college team was denied. Here's what it means.

title: Men's Bracketology: Who's a lock and who's on the bubble?
content: Right now, it's about looking beyond UNC's numbers and taking into account the context that has the Tar Heels as a 4-seed.

title: Women's Bracketology: Bubble trouble for the ACC?
content: The ACC and Big 12 will have a say in the field's final teams. For now, the Last Four In all hail from the ACC.

title: How the last WBC helped Team USA assemble its best pitching staff ever
content: Three years after an epic end to the World Baseball Classic, American stars are pitching in like never before.

title: Ranked: The top 25 manager jobs in soccer, from best to worst
content: Most of soccer's top coaching jobs will be vacant in the next year or so. Let's rank which jobs are the most -- and least -- attractive, from clubs to national teams.

title: Has time run out for Frank? Spurs' latest loss puts him in unprecedented danger
content: After Tottenham's latest loss, it's fair to wonder how long they can continue with Thomas Frank at the helm.

title: Everything you need to know for the men's Olympic hockey tournament
content: Just tuning in to hockey again for the first time in a long time? Get caught up here with all the key intel.

title: Team USA figure skating costumes: 2026 Olympic designs and drama
content: A bull, a building or a matador -- will Team USA's figure skating style win gold at the 2026 Winter Games? Learn more about fashion on the ice now.

title: NASCAR descends on Daytona eager to move on from turbulent offseason, get back to racing
content: It was a heartbreaking offseason for much of NASCAR, and as the garage descends on Daytona, the stock car world is ready to refocus on racing.

title: What Klint Kubiak hire means for Las Vegas: two-RB system, more 12-personnel and a potential Mendoza pairing
content: The Raiders hired Klint Kubiak. Here's what that means for Las Vegas, plus what's next in the offseason.

title: Drake Maye lost his first Super Bowl. His future -- and the Patriots' -- remains bright
content: Drake Maye and the Patriots weren't able to do much in Super Bowl LX, but their future might still be bright.

title: Making sense of Super Bowl LX: The Seahawks mixed up their game plan, and the Patriots couldn't adapt
content: Let's size up Seattle's defensive wrinkles, an explosive RB, great special teams and Sam Darnold's performance.

title: Nothing left to prove, resilient Sam Darnold makes ultimate statement
content: The QB isn't motivated to prove the haters wrong, but to prove people right. And on Sunday, he did just that.

title: NFL playoffs top moments: From Caleb Williams' miracle TD to the Super Bowl MVP﻿
content: Here's a look at the wild and woolly NFL postseason, from frigid temperatures to trick plays and Super Bowl MVPs.

title: Texas Rangers' promotional giveaways include bloodstained Nolan Ryan tribute jersey
content: On May 29, the Rangers will give away a jersey with a bloodstain imitating Ryan's iconic uniform from when he continued pitching after a ball split open his lip.

title: 10, Including Gunman, Killed In Canada School Shooting, Dozens Injured
content: Ten people, including the gunman, were killed and dozens were injured in a shooting at a school in Canada's British Columbia on Wednesday, police said.

title: 'Soggy Poppadums' vs 'Fine Tandoori': UK MPs Debate Benefits Of India Trade Deal
content: The Britishers are known for their wits, and a specimen of it was seen in the UK Parliament this week, when members across party lines debated on the merits of the India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) in the House of Commons.

title: Fugitive Wanted In Connection With Murder In Haryana Deported From US
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), in collaboration with the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) and the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA), has successfully coordinated the return of wanted fugitive Sombir Motta from the United States of America.

title: Karnataka Congress MLA Flaunts Guns In Reel On 'Fa9la' Song, Probe On
content: A Congress leader has courted trouble by making a reel replicating the popular song "Fa9la" from the blockbuster movie 'Dhurandhar'.

title: Bengal-Noida Cops Clash Over Arrest Linked To Mahua Moitra Forged Chat Case
content: West Bengal Police and Noida Police have issued sharply conflicting versions of an attempted arrest connected to the alleged circulation of forged private chats linked to Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra.

title: "Had Lunch": Top Trump Official Admits He Visited Epstein Island
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick admitted on Tuesday to having lunch on the private island of late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein in 2012, but denied closer ties, amid bipartisan calls for his resignation.

title: The Horrors Of 1975 In Bangladesh: When Shaikh Hasina's Family Was Massacred
content: Bangladesh is heading into its first parliamentary election since the ouster of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in August 2024.

title: 9 Nations, 5 Decades: How French Paedophile Assaulted 89 Minors
content: A French prosecutor has made public the identity of a 79-year-old former educator accused of raping and sexually assaulting 89 minors over more than five decades.

title: Trump Administration Removes LGBTQ Pride Flag From New York's Stonewall Monument
content: US President Donald Trump's administration has removed a large rainbow Pride flag that flew over the Stonewall National Monument, which marks the birthplace of the modern gay rights movement in New York City.

title: Earthquake Of Magnitude 6.0 Hits Pacific Ocean
content: An earthquake of magnitude 6.0 rattled the Indian Ocean on Wednesday, as per a statement by the National Center for Seismology (NCS).

title: Biker's Death Case: Delhi Court Grants Protection From Arrest To Contractor
content: Delhi's Dwarka Court on Tuesday granted protection from arrest to contractor Kavish Gupta. He had approached the court for anticipatory bail after receiving a notice from the police to join the investigation into the biker's death case.

title: Video: FBI Releases Images Of Masked Suspect In Hunt For US Anchor's Mother
content: A masked person with a handgun holster was caught on camera outside Nancy Guthrie's front door the night she disappeared, images released Tuesday by the FBI show.

title: US Justice Department Opens Unredacted Epstein Files To Lawmakers
content: The US Justice Department opened the unredacted Jeffrey Epstein files to review by members of Congress on Monday as several lawmakers expressed concern that some names have been removed from the publicly released records.

title: US To Scrap Legal Cornerstone Of Climate Regulations This Week
content: President Donald Trump is set this week to scrap a landmark scientific finding that greenhouse gases jeopardize public health by driving climate change -- the bedrock of US regulations to curb planet-warming pollution.

title: Minnesota Governor Says Federal Immigration Crackdown Could End Within Days
content: Governor Tim Walz said Tuesday that he expects the federal immigration crackdown in Minnesota will end in "days, not weeks and months," based on his recent conversations with top Trump administration officials.

title: Colombian President Claims To Have Escaped Assassination Attempt
content: Colombian President Gustavo Petro said Tuesday he had escaped an assassination attempt hours earlier after months of warnings about an alleged plot by drug traffickers to attack him.

title: Construction Begins Today At Bengal's Babri Masjid Replica Spot
content: Two months after laying the foundation of the Babri replica, the construction of the project is about to begin in Murshidabad's Beldanga today.

title: US Immigration Officials Grilled By Congress Over Trump Crackdown
content: The heads of US immigration agencies faced heavy criticism in Congress Tuesday as they defended President Donald Trump's mass deportation drive and fielded questions about the fatal shootings of two protesters in Minneapolis.

title: 100 Students Hospitalised In Uttar Pradesh After Taking Deworming Tablets
content: Around 100 students were hospitalised on Tuesday after they fell ill following a deworming drive at a local school here, officials said.

title: MLS jersey Power Rankings: Who's the best dressed in 2026?
content: All 30 MLS clubs have new jerseys for 2026, so who boasts the best (and worst) threads in the league? ESPN ranks them from first to worst.

title: See in photos how the Seahawks stopped the run and won the Super Bowl
content: The defense doesn't often take center stage in the NFL's championship game, but the  Seattle Seahawks ' unit took over in its  29-13 win  against the  New England Patriots  in Santa Clara, California Sunday night. The Patriots were scoreless in their 10 possessions of the game, tying the Colts (Super Bowl III) for the fourth-longest drought to begin a Super Bowl, according to Elias Sports Bureau. The Seahawks' defense held the Patriots to four first downs, 51 total yards, 2.0 yards per play and three sacks in the first half. We captured the plays that secured the Seahawks their second Super Bowl win.

title: Who will hoist the Heisman in 2026? A way-too-early look
